description: Seychelles monitors individuals with COVID19 on 8 April 2020, as well as those in close contact with them. The implemented measure admits them in a quarantine facility where they will be monitored for 14 days.
The tourism department in Seychelles is planning to introduce an app that will track tourists’ movements to facilitate contact tracing starting 1 June.
All passengers traveling to Seychelles must have proof of a negative COVID-19 PCR test that is 48 hours or less prior to boarding the flight to Seychelles beginning 1 June.
In Seychelles entry screening will be done to passengers upon arrival. They may be required to undergo a rapid antigen test, beginning 1 June
All passengers and crew in Seychelles must have been screened for COVID-19 and have a recent negative PCR test prior to entering Seychelles waters

The repatriations of Seychellois stranded overseas will be carried out strictly in accordance with guidelines and criteria set by health authorities, a process being facilitated by the local foreign affairs department starting 15 June.

All passengers coming to Seychelles from Aug. 1 when the airport opens for scheduled passenger flights must have proof of a negative COVID-19 PCR test not more than 72 hours old before boarding their flight to the island nation
Seychelles expands health resources such as isolation and quarantine facilities in Mahe on 19 March 2020.

description: Beginning 7 May Seychelles will perform random tests for COVID-19 to be done on the population of Seychelles over the next several weeks to determine whether there have been infections through community transmission
On 1 June it will be compulsory for all visitors entering the Seychelles to take a Covid-19 test 48 hours prior to disembarking on the Pointe Larue International Airport.

The list of Category 2 countries has been revised effective from November 16 and it includes France, UK, Switzerland, Germany, Austria, UAE and Italy. Visitors from these countries can still come to Seychelles but they have to do a PCR test 48 hours or less before arrival and they have to book in Category 2 establishments. After five days a PCR test will be done and if it is negative they can continue their stay in the same place under certain conditions or move to a Category 1 establishment.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: All travelers both foreigners and Seychellois citizens coming to Seychelles will have to take a COVID-19 PCR test on the sixth day after their arrival.
Seychelles students are repatriated from China due to COVID-19 on 28 January.
type_text: Citizen repatriation of students from China. The policy is mandatory but preference is given to students in high risk areas.

description: Air Seychelles repatriates 52 Seychellois nationals from Mauritius on 23 March 2020.
type_text: Seychelles is repriating 52 citizens from Mauritius using Air Seychelles.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Employers that intend to retain the services of foreign workers with a Gainful Occupation Permit (GOP) who are currently outside of Seychelles due to closed borders have to inform the employment department by June 30
type_text: Essentially, there are foreign workers in Seychelles who work under a Gainful Occupation Permit (GOP). This allows the holder to be gainfully occupied in Seychelles and this could be as an employee or as a self-employed person. Employers who want to continue employing these workers, need to notify the employment department by June 30.

description: The health authorities and the foreign affairs department are working to repatriate almost 250 Seychellois stranded overseas beginning 16 June
type_text: '- The health authorities and the foreign affairs department are working to repatriate almost 250 Seychellois stranded overseas

description: In Seychelles, March 2nd 2020. Organisers of large public gatherings are being advised to cancel and postpone the event until further notice
Seychelles advises that organisers of large public events must cancel or postpone their events on 2March2020.
Seychelles advises that organisers of large public events must cancel or postpone their events on 2March2020.
Seychelles advises entertainment venues likes cinemas and fun fairs to cancel all events. Religious organisations also advised to limit contact during activities from March 18 onwards.

The sports council in Seychelles will make available facilities for competitions beginning 1 June. If they cannot satisfy the criteria set by the Department of Health they will have to organize their competitions without spectators. The regulations say training can only resume in small groups.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of a recreational or commercial event

description: Social distancing measures are enforced in Seychelles from 22 March onwards.
